meanings.definition: To spring or fly back, as in consequence of force of impact or the force of the discharge, as a firearm.
meanings.sent1: The ball recoiled off the wall.
meanings.sent2: She recoiled in surprise when the balloon popped.
meanings.sent3: The cat recoiled playfully from the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His words recoiled in her mind, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The spring recoiled with a loud twang.

meanings.definition: To draw back; start or shrink back, as in alarm, horror, or disgust.
meanings.sent1: He recoiled from the slimy texture of the food.
meanings.sent2: The child recoiled in fear at the sight of the spider.
meanings.sent3: She recoiled dramatically from the bad smell.
meanings.sent4: The idea of failure made him recoil instinctively.
meanings.sent5: The sudden noise made her recoil in shock.

meanings.definition: The act of recoiling; a starting or falling back; a rebound.
meanings.sent1: The recoil of the gun was strong.
meanings.sent2: The recoil of the spring propelled the toy forward.
meanings.sent3: The recoil of the trampoline sent him higher than expected.
meanings.sent4: The recoil of the car hitting the wall was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The recoil of the ball hitting the ground was minimal.
